documents_reviewed.title: Bar Application – Character and Fitness Disclosure
documents_reviewed.summary: Application deferred 2023-12-18 under CF-CRIM-DUI; discloses 2020 DUI misdemeanor (probation completed 2021-08-14) and 2021 academic probation (resolved in applicant's favor, no transcript notation).

documents_reviewed.title: Mental Health Treatment Records – Anxiety Disorder
documents_reviewed.summary: 42 CBT sessions (Oct 2020–Jun 2023) for GAD and situational Adjustment Disorder; clinician attributes DUI to acute crisis period, not a conduct pattern, and issued Treatment Completion Certificate 2023-06-15.

documents_reviewed.title: Personal Statement – Jordan Taylor
documents_reviewed.summary: Applicant accepts full responsibility for DUI, contextualizes it within concurrent family crisis, reports sobriety since November 2020, and references separately submitted probation completion report (Officer L. Vasquez, CR-2020-04471).

documents_reviewed.title: Paralegal Internship Verification – Hernandez & Associates
documents_reviewed.summary: 12-week internship (May–Aug 2022) rated Outstanding overall by supervising attorneys across three practice areas; zero unexcused absences, zero policy violations, unconditional rehire eligibility.

overall_summary: Application deferred pending C&F review on single DUI misdemeanor (2020, probation completed). Three years of sustained treatment, no recidivism, outstanding professional conduct record, and voluntary full disclosure support rehabilitation. Academic matter resolved without findings.
missing_evidence: Probation completion report from Supervising Officer L. Vasquez (CR-2020-04471) — referenced in taylor-004 as submitted separately; not present in application folder
